title: Mike Diessner
text:
I am a third-year PhD student at the School of Computing at Newcastle University in the United Kingdom. Within the university, I am partof the Cloud Computing for Big Data CDT and the Fluid Dynamics Lab.

My research focuses on computer emulators and the optimisation of physical experiments and computer simulators. I am also developing NUBO, a transparent Bayesian optimisation package in Python, with the aim of making the optimisation of expensive-to-evaluate black-box functions accessible to researchers from all disciplines. An open-source version is available here.

title: Mike Diessner
text:
📰 Publications

2023
Mike Diessner, Kevin Wilson, and Richard D. Whalley. “NUBO: A Transparent Python Package for Bayesian Optimisation,” arXiv preprint arXiv:2305.06709, 2023.

Joe O’Connor, Mike Diessner, Kevin Wilson, Richard D. Whalley, Andrew Wynn, and Sylvain Laizet. “Optimisation and Analysis of Streamwise-Varying Wall- Normal Blowing in a Turbulent Boundary Layer,” Flow, Turbulence and Combustion, 2023.


2022
Mike Diessner, Joe O’Connor, Andrew Wynn, Sylvain Laizet, Yu Guan, Kevin Wilson, and Richard D. Whalley. “Investigating Bayesian optimization for expensive-to-evaluate black box functions: Application in fluid dynamics,” Frontiers in Applied Mathematics and Statistics, 2022.

Matthew L. Thomas, Gavin Shaddick, David Topping, Karyn Morrissey, Thomas J. Brannan, Mike Diessner, Ruth C. E. Bowyer, Stefan Siegert, Hugh Coe, James Evans, Fernando Benitez-Paez, and James V. Zidek. “A Data Integration Approach to Estimating Personal Exposures to Air Pollution,” 2022 IEEE International Conference on Big Data (Big Data), 2022.

title: Mike Diessner
text:
🌍 Presentations

Upcoming
76th Annual Meeting of the Division of Fluid Dynamics, “Leveraging Bayesian Optimisation for Expensive Experiments and Simulations in Fluid Dynamics with Uncontrollable Dynamic Variables,” Walter E. Washington Convention Center, Washington (DC), USA. 19-21 November 2023.


2023
UK Fluids Conference 2023, “A Machine Learning Framework for the Optimisation of Experiments and Simulations in Fluid Dynamics,” Technology & Innovation Centre, Glasgow, United Kingdom.
Open Research Awards 2023, “NUBO: An Open-Source AI Framework for Optimisation,” Newcastle University, Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom.


2022
European Drag Reduction and Flow Control Meeting, “On the development of a Bayesian optimisation framework for turbulent drag reduction,” Conservatoire National des Arts et Métiers, Paris, France.

title: Mike Diessner
text:
💻 Software

NUBO: Bayesian optimisation framework for solving expenisve-to-evaluate black-box functions (Python).
    Website: NUBO    Install: PyPI    Source: GitHub

simplelhs: Simple implementation of Latin hypercube sampling to generate space filling designs (Python).
    Install: PyPI    Source: GitHub

benchfuncs: Selection of benchmark functions to test optimisation algorithms (Python).
Source: GitHub

title: Mike Diessner
text:
💡 Teaching
I worked as a teaching assistant on the following courses:

Computing Foundations of Data Science: Postgraduate-level module teaching the fundamentals of programming in Python.

Data Management and Exploratory Data Analysis: Postgraduate-level module teaching students all necessary tools to analyse data with R.

Statistics for Empirical Psychology: Undergraduate-level module teaching the fundamentals of statistics to psychology students (linear regression, mixed-effects model, hypothesis testing, etc.).

title: Mike Diessner
text:
🎓 Education


PhD in Computing
Newcastle University
Advisors: Richard D. Whalley and Kevin Wilson


Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom
June 2021 - August 2024



Investigation of Bayesian optimisation for expensive-to-evaluate black-box functions.
Application to computer simulators and physical experiments in engineering to find optimal active blowing strategies to maximise drag reduction.




PGDip in Computing
Newcastle University


Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom
September 2020 - May 2021




MSc in Statistics
University of Exeter


Exeter, United Kingdom
September 2019 - August 2020



Thesis: “Using Agent-based Modelling to Estimate Personal Exposure to PM2.5 in Devon”.
Developed model was later used in the paper “A Data Integration Approach to Estimating Personal Exposures to Air Pollution”.




BSc in Economics
University of Bonn


Bonn, Germany
September 2014 - February 2018



Thesis: “Universal basic income and its effects on the labour market in Germany”.

title: Mike Diessner
text:
🏆 Awards

Open Research Award for making research more transparent, accessible and reproducible. Awarded by Newcastle University at the Open Research Awards 2023 as the only student among researchers, lecturers and professors (£150).
Full Four-Year Studentship to attend the Cloud Computing for Big Data Centre for Doctoral Training. Awarded by Newcastle University and the Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council covering costs of living, tuition, equipment, workshops, travel, conferences and more (over £100,000).
MSc Academic Award for the best overall performance on a postgraduate Mathematics programme. Awarded by the University of Exeter for the academic year 2019/20 (£100).
Dean’s Commendation for the performance at the top end of the First Class range. Awarded by the University of Exeter.

title: Mike Diessner
text:
⭐ Certificates

AgilePM Foundation issued by APMG International in July 2023. Knowledge of the key principles and terminology within Agile Project Management and an understanding of the underpinning philosophy and principles of Agile, as well as the lifecycle, techniques and products of an Agile project.
